resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

worklogs.comment:
jonkeane commented on PR #12883:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/12883#issuecomment-1109055447

   Would you mind rebasing this and looking into the windows CI failures? We might be too late already, but we really should make sure this is done + more importantly there are no issues before we release

dragosmg commented on PR #12883:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/12883#issuecomment-1109502786

   All window jobs seem to be tripping up in the same spot (involving formats), with the following error message:
   ```
   Invalid: Cannot find locale 'English_United States.1252': locale::facet::_S_create_c_locale name not valid
   ```
   
   As far as I can tell it has to do with the `format`, in general, and `"%b"` + `"%B"`, in particular, as they rely on the locale in order to figure out the abbreviated / full month names.

dragosmg commented on PR #12883:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/12883#issuecomment-1112139397

   We could link to [ARROW-13133](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-13133) to solve the remaining locale-related issues. Not sure a new Jira is needed.

wjones127 commented on PR #12883:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/12883#issuecomment-1112273522

   > All window jobs seem to be tripping up in the same spot (involving formats)
   
   @dragosmg This is expected. We don't support locales other than the "C" locale, so you can't format timestamps in different locales. From my earlier research, this seems to be an issue with MINGW itself. R gets around this by vendoring the strftime implementation:
   
   > However, not all OSes (notably Windows) provided strptime and many issues were found for those which did, so since 2000 R has used a fork of code from glibc. The forked code uses the system's strftime to find the locale-specific day and month names and any AM/PM indicator.
   >
   >On some platforms (including Windows and by default on macOS) the system's strftime is replaced (along with most of the rest of the C-level datetime code) by code modified from IANA's tzcode distribution (https://www.iana.org/time-zones).

jonkeane commented on PR #12883:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/12883#issuecomment-1112280224

   And presumably, we could set the locale for windows only on the tests that still have the skip here, like we do in test-dplyr-funcs-datetime.R ?

dragosmg commented on PR #12883:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/12883#issuecomment-1112280619

   Thanks @wjones127 The absence of locale support is showing up in a number of different places (for example, some of the datetime parsing). Do you think it's worth having a separate Jira to discuss locale support? [ARROW-13133](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-13133) touches on locale, but doesn't go far enough.

wjones127 commented on PR #12883:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/12883#issuecomment-1112307309

   I made an issue for looking into locales on Windows MINGW systems / RTools: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-16399

jonkeane closed pull request #12883: ARROW-16073: [R] clean-up date time unit testing once tzdb is available on Windows
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/12883

ursabot commented on PR #12883:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/12883#issuecomment-1118766061

   Benchmark runs are scheduled for baseline = 48a6e2588bd28bb9446981a985681c959566d2c5 and contender = 3c03d4936445781e29e41392d9a0bc3db62b39f2. 3c03d4936445781e29e41392d9a0bc3db62b39f2 is a master commit associated with this PR. Results will be available as each benchmark for each run completes.

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description: We are skipping a high number of tests on Windows due to the {{tz}} database not being available. Once ARROW-13168 is solved, we need to have a thorough look at the skipped tests / reduced functionality.
fields.summary: [R] clean-up date time unit testing once tzdb is available on Windows

comments.body: If we haven't done this already, we should definitely do it before the release to catch if we've introduced any regressions with our liberal use of skip on windows...
